Welcome to pyweb-hw-14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is up and running. It does this by making a request to the database, and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t return any results, then we know something’s wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the key &quot;message&quot; and value &quot;welcome to fastapi!&quot;

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, like databases or caches.

Returns:

A list of functions to be run in the background

classmethod validade_algorithm(value)¶
The validade_algorithm function is a helper function that validates the algorithm used to sign the JWT.

It raises an error if it’s not HS256 or HS512.

Parameters:

  • cls – Pass the class that is being validated

  • value – Pass the value of the algorithm parameter in the jwt

Returns:

The value of the algorithm

REST API dependecies Database¶

class src.dependencies.database.DataBaseSessionManager(url: str)¶

Bases: object

session()¶

The session function is a context manager that provides a transactional scope around a series of operations. It will automatically rollback the session if an exception occurs, or commit the session otherwise.

Parameters:

self – Represent the instance of the class

Returns:

A context manager that can be used in a with statement

async src.dependencies.database.get_db()¶

The get_db function is a coroutine that returns an async context manager. The context manager yields a database session, which can be used to query the database. When the block of code exits, the session is automatically closed.

Returns:

A context manager

async update_token(user: UserModel, refresh_token: str | None)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

If the user does not have a refresh token, it creates one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • user – UserModel: Get the user id from the usermodel class

  • refresh_token – str | None: Check if the refresh token is valid or not

Returns:

The token that was updated

REST API routers auth¶

async src.routers.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their username, which is then used to find their account in the database. If no account exists with that username, an error message will be returned. If there is an account with that username but it has already been confirmed, a message saying so will be returned. Otherwise, if there is an unconfirmed account with that username, its status will be changed from unconfirmed

(False) to confirmed (True). A success message

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

async src.routers.auth.forgot_password(username: str, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The forgot_password function is used to send a password reset email to the user.

The function takes in the username of the user and sends an email with a link that allows them to reset their password.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user that is requesting to reset their password

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Send an email to the user :return: A json response

async src.routers.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make authenticated requests against protected endpoints.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary of the access token, refresh token and the bearer type

async src.routers.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the refresh token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the refresh token from the header :return: A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routers.auth.reset_password(body: UserResetPasswordSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), dependencies=[Depends(RateLimiter)])¶
The reset_password function allows a user to reset their password.
The function takes in the following parameters:

body (UserResetPasswordSchema): A UserResetPasswordSchema object containing the username, password, and confirm_password of the user. db (AsyncSession): An AsyncSession object that is used to connect to our database. This parameter is optional and defaults to Depends(get_db).

Parameters:

  • body – UserResetPasswordSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • dependencies – Add a dependency to the function

  • seconds – Set the time limit for the rate limiter

:param : Get the user’s username and password :return: A dict

async src.routers.auth.signup(body: UserCreateSchema, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), dependencies=[Depends(RateLimiter)])¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It also sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account. The function takes in three arguments: body, background_tasks, and request.

Parameters:

  • body – UserCreateSchema: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • dependencies – Add the rate limiter to the signup function

  • seconds – Set the time limit for the rate limiter

:param : Get the user’s username and base_url to send a verification email :return: A user object

REST API routers contacts_items¶

async src.routers.contacts_items.create_contact(body: ContactCreateSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact.

— post:

tags: [contacts] summary: Creates a new contact. description: Creates a new contact and returns the created object. requestBody:

required: true content:{application/json}:{schema}ContactCreateSchema{/schema}

Parameters:

  • body – ContactCreateSchema: Validate the request body against the contactcreateschema schema

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the service layer

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the current user :return: A contactmodel object

async src.routers.contacts_items.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The delete_contact function takes in a contact_id and uses it to find the corresponding ContactModel object in the database. It then deletes that object, and returns it as JSON.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url path

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the service class

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contactmodel object

async src.routers.contacts_items.find_contacts(key_word: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The find_contacts function is used to find contacts in the database.

It takes a key_word and returns all contacts that match the key_word.

Parameters:

  • key_word – str: Get the key word from the request body

  • title – Provide a description of the parameter in the openapi documentation

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the database

:param : Pass the key word to search for a contact :return: A list of contacts

async src.routers.contacts_items.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Determine how many contacts to skip

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the database

:param : Limit the number of contacts returned by the function :return: The following:

async src.routers.contacts_items.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the contactservice

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the request

:param : Get the contact_id from the url :return: A contactmodel object

async src.routers.contacts_items.upcoming_birthday(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The upcoming_birthday function returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Set the limit of contacts to be returned

  • ge – Specify a minimum value

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip a number of records

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the contactservice

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user

:param : Get the limit of contacts to be returned :return: A list of contacts

async src.routers.contacts_items.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactCreateSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactCreateSchema): A schema containing all fields that can be updated for a ContactModel object.

See ContactCreateSchema for more details on what fields are required and optional, as well as their types and formats.

db (AsyncSession, optional): An async session with an open connection to the database; defaults to Depends(get_db).

This is used by SQLAlchemy’s ORM layer when querying

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to update

  • body – ContactCreateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the service

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the auth_service

:param : Get the contact id :return: A contactmodel object

REST API routers users¶

async src.routers.users.get_current_user(user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It will return the user object of the currently authenticated user, or None if no authentication token was provided in the request.

Parameters:

user – UserModel: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

The send_default_avatar function is a route that returns the default avatar image.

user (#) – UserModel: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: A fileresponse object

The upload_avatar function uploads a user’s avatar to Cloudinary and updates the database with the new URL.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • user – UserModel: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session, which is used to interact with the database

async change_password(body: UserResetPasswordSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶
The change_password function is used to change the password of a user.
Args:

body (UserResetPasswordSchema): The schema for changing a user’s password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • body – UserResetPasswordSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the userrepo class

Returns:

Nothing

async confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → None¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. db (AsyncSession): An async database session object.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • email – str: Pass the email to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the userrepo class

Returns:

None

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing all the information to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter that specifies how long until

this token expires, in seconds. If not specified, it defaults to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Store the data that you want to encode

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A token, but i don’t know how to use it

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function creates a JWT token that is used to verify the user’s email address.
The token contains the following data:

  • iat (issued at): The time when the token was created.

  • exp (expiration): When this token expires, 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the information in the data dictionary

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time until expiration of the JWT, defaults to 15 minutes if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Store the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the token

Returns:

A jwt token

async create_user(body: UserCreateSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserCreateSchema): The schema for creating a new user. db (AsyncSession): The database session to use for this request.

Returns:

UserModel: A model of the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • body – UserCreateSchema: Validate the data that is passed in

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database connection

Returns:

A user object

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it. If the scope is not &quot;refresh_token&quot;, then an error is raised. If the JWTError exception occurs, then another error is raised.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The username of the user who made the request

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token and returns the user object if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized).

Parameters:

  • self – Denote that the function is a method of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. If the token is invalid, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is being decoded

Returns:

The email address that was used to create the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

async get_refresh_token_by_user(user: UserModel, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_refresh_token_by_user function is used to get the refresh token for a user.

Args:

user (UserModel): The UserModel object that contains the information about the user. db (AsyncSession): The database session that will be used to query for data.

Returns: A string containing the refresh token of a given user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • user – UserModel: Get the user_id from the usermodel object

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The refresh token of the user

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

A user object

async update_refresh_token(user: UserModel, refresh_token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶
The update_refresh_token function updates the refresh token for a user.
Args:

self (UserService): The UserService object. user (UserModel): The UserModel object to update the refresh token for. refresh_token (str | None): The new value of the refresh token, or None if it should be deleted from storage.

Parameters:

  • self – Denote that the function is a method of the class

  • user – UserModel: Identify the user that is being updated

  • refresh_token – str | None: Update the refresh token in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the userrepo class

Returns:

The usermodel object

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_pasword)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password, and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login attempt is valid.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Store the password that is being verified

  • hashed_pasword – Compare the plain_password parameter to see if they match

Returns:

A boolean value, true or false

async get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, user: UserModel)¶
The get_all_contacts function returns all contacts from the database.
Args:

limit (int): The maximum number of contacts to return. offset (int): The starting point for the query, used for pagination. user (UserModel): A UserModel object representing a user in the database.

Returns:

list[Contact]: A list of Contact objects representing all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned from the database

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • user – UserModel: Get the user id from the database

Returns:

All contacts from the database

async update_contact(contact_id, body, user: UserModel)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (dict): A dictionary containing all of the fields that need to be updated for this user.

Example: {‘first_name’: ‘John’, ‘last_name’: ‘Doe’}

user (UserModel): The current logged in user, used for authorization purposes only.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • contact_id – Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – Update the contact

  • user – UserModel: Get the user_id from the user object

Returns:

The contact object

async send_request_to_reset_password(username: EmailStr, host: str)¶
The send_request_to_reset_password function sends a request to reset the password of a user.
Args:

username (str): The email address of the user who wants to reset their password. host (str): The hostname where this service is running, e.g., &quot;localhost&quot; or &quot;127.0.0.2&quot;.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – EmailStr: Specify the username of the user who is requesting to reset their password

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to send_request_to_reset_password function

Returns:

A token_verification

async send_verification_mail(username: EmailStr, host: str)¶
The send_verification_mail function sends a verification email to the user’s email address.

The function takes in two parameters: username and host. The username parameter is the user’s email address, which is used as both the recipient of the verification mail and as part of a token that will be sent with it.

The host parameter is used to create an absolute URL for use in verifying that a user has clicked on their verification link.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – EmailStr: Pass in the user’s email address

  • host – str: Generate the link to verify the email

:param : Create a token for the user :return: A message
